answers.answer: I have noticed a considerable change in my eyesight since falling pregnant, normally its perfect but i am going to book an appointment with my optician as i think i may have to start wearing glasses again.(I had them for reading before but was told last year i could stop using them)I get blurred vision moreso in one eye, i think its normal and due to increased bloodflow
i see the sparkles too..it strarted in my 1st tri when i would throw up..now it happens when i sneeze or cough really hard
I have read that you need to report any disturbance in vision to your Dr.
Thanks ladies. I will consult my gyn. I hope isn`t a sign of preeclampsia because I don`t have the other major signs (swellings, high blood pressure, proteinuria).

I get sparkles too, Actually it's literally like seeing stars for me. It happens when I cough too hard, stand up too fast, or stuff like that. My BP is normal and everything else is.I think it's because when you cough or sneeze or stand up fast it temporarily causes a disturbance with your BP. It goes away for me after a few seconds.Oh and it's happened when I was throwing up from M/S, you know? When you heave so hard that your face gets red... that's when.

question: The last two weeks I have sparkles in my vision and blured vision. This is not all the time but like attacks during the day. I have normal blod pressure, no swellings, no proteine in urine. Now I`m 29 weeks and everything else is normal expect a light anaemia (hemoglobin 115 g/l). Does anybody else have this symptoms?
title: Sparkles in vision? Any advice?
